definition: hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)

sentences.english: When it comes to resenting the wealthy, China is far outpacing the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 在仇富的程度上，中國遠遠超過了美國和英國。

sentences.english: The view that all wealthy people are evil will result in hatred for wealth.
sentences.chinese: 有錢人都是黑心腸的觀點，會導致仇富心理的產生。

sentences.english: Resentment of the rich was no longer a potent force in American politics.
sentences.chinese: 仇富心理不再是美國政治中的有效力量。

sentences.english: The rising tide of anti-wealth sentiment could well affect how conspicuous the rich want to be.
sentences.chinese: 日益高漲的仇富情緒很可能影響富人對露富的程度。

sentences.english: Why are the poor people in China poor, because they hate rich people.
sentences.chinese: 中國窮人爲什麼窮，因爲他們都有仇富心理。

definition: the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
sour grapes (set expr. based on Aesop)/lit. to say grapes are sour when you can't eat them

definition: angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
the notion in society that it's better to get ahead in the world by abandoning one's scruples than to suffer poverty/lit. despising poverty but not prostitution (idiom)
to favor the rich and disdain the poor (idiom)/snobbish
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
children of officials/word created by analogy with 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
